result.execSummary:
The defendant Tina Marie LeMere was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tina Marie LeMere is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tina Marie LeMere was found guilty of Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes: Work out payment plan with agent.
Work out payment plan with agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 4-12-16.
Pay DNA surcharge.

May not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No possession or consumption of alcohol, illegal drugs, intoxicating substances or any other controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with known drug users, drug sellers or places known where drugs can be obtained illegally.

Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.
Pay court ordered obligations and supervision fees to the Dept. of Corrections.

timeConds.notes:
Serve 30 days jail commencing 4-12-16 at 7:00 p.m.  No good time.
No credit.  Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.
60 days jail STAYED!  To be imposed if defendant does not complete the 780 hours community service within the first 2 years of probation.
